# Example Output - Import with Errors

## Scenario 1: Disk Full (Critical Error - Immediate Abort)

```
Import session: 2025-12-15-110145
Browse imported files: /library/imports/2025-12-15-110145

Copied /sd/IMG_001.jpg â†’ /library/john/2024/01/01/IMG_001.jpg
Copied /sd/IMG_002.jpg â†’ /library/john/2024/01/02/IMG_002.jpg
Progress: 2/100 files (15.3/s, ETA: 6s)

âš ï¸  ABORTING IMPORT: Critical system error detected - aborting to prevent data loss
Processed: 3/100 files before abort

âŒ Import encountered 1 errors:

  ðŸ”´ Critical: 1 (system-level issues)

Error categories:
  â€¢ io_error: 1

Recent errors:

1. /sd/IMG_003.jpg
   Category: io_error | Severity: critical
   Error: write failed: no space left on device
   ðŸ’¡ Suggestion: Free up disk space on the destination drive and retry the import

Suggested next steps:
  â€¢ Check disk space and permissions
  â€¢ Verify source media (SD card, external drive) is properly connected
  â€¢ Check session manifest for detailed error log
```

## Scenario 2: High Error Rate (50% threshold)

```
Import session: 2025-12-15-110230
Browse imported files: /library/imports/2025-12-15-110230

Copied /sd/IMG_001.jpg â†’ /library/john/2024/01/01/IMG_001.jpg
Error processing /sd/IMG_002.jpg
Copied /sd/IMG_003.jpg â†’ /library/john/2024/01/03/IMG_003.jpg
Error processing /sd/IMG_004.jpg
Progress: 10/100 files (8.2/s, ETA: 11s) | Errors: 5
...
Progress: 20/40 files (7.1/s, ETA: 3s) | Errors: 11

âš ï¸  ABORTING IMPORT: Error rate too high (11/20 = 55.0%)
This suggests a systemic problem - check system resources and permissions
```

## Scenario 3: 10 Consecutive Errors

```
Import session: 2025-12-15-110315
Browse imported files: /library/imports/2025-12-15-110315

Copied /sd/IMG_001.jpg â†’ /library/john/2024/01/01/IMG_001.jpg
Copied /sd/IMG_002.jpg â†’ /library/john/2024/01/02/IMG_002.jpg
Progress: 5/100 files (12.5/s, ETA: 8s) | Errors: 0

Error processing /sd/corrupted_001.jpg
Error processing /sd/corrupted_002.jpg
Error processing /sd/corrupted_003.jpg
...
Error processing /sd/corrupted_010.jpg
Progress: 15/100 files (10.2/s, ETA: 8s) | Errors: 10

âš ï¸  ABORTING IMPORT: 10 consecutive errors detected - likely systemic issue (disk full, permissions, etc.)
Processed: 15/100 files before abort
```

## Scenario 4: Successful Import with Some Errors

```
Import session: 2025-12-15-110400
Browse imported files: /library/imports/2025-12-15-110400

Copied /sd/IMG_001.jpg â†’ /library/john/2024/01/01/IMG_001.jpg
Copied /sd/IMG_002.jpg â†’ /library/john/2024/01/02/IMG_002.jpg
Warning: low confidence date for /sd/no_exif.jpg (using 2025-12-15)
Copied /sd/no_exif.jpg â†’ /library/john/noexif/2025-12/no_exif.jpg
Progress: 10/100 files (15.2/s, ETA: 6s) | Errors: 0
...
Progress: 50/100 files (14.8/s, ETA: 3s) | Errors: 2
...
Progress: 100/100 files (14.5/s, ETA: 0s) | Errors: 3

âœ… Completed: 100 files in 7s (14.3 files/sec)

Import Summary:
  âœ“ Copied:            95 files
  âœ“ Timestamped:       2 files
  âŠ˜ Skipped (duplicates): 0 files
  âœ— Errors:            3 files

ðŸ“ Browse session: /library/imports/2025-12-15-110400

âŒ Import encountered 3 errors:

  ðŸŸ  Errors:   2 (file-level issues)
  ðŸŸ¡ Warnings: 1 (recoverable issues)

Error categories:
  â€¢ hash_mismatch: 2
  â€¢ metadata_error: 1

Recent errors:

1. /sd/corrupted.jpg
   Category: hash_mismatch | Severity: error
   Error: hash verification failed after copy /sd/corrupted.jpg -> /library/john/2024/01/05/corrupted.jpg
   ðŸ’¡ Suggestion: File may be corrupted - verify source file integrity or try re-importing

2. /sd/bad_exif.jpg
   Category: hash_mismatch | Severity: error
   Error: hash verification failed after copy /sd/bad_exif.jpg -> /library/john/2024/01/06/bad_exif.jpg
   ðŸ’¡ Suggestion: File may be corrupted - verify source file integrity or try re-importing

3. /sd/unknown_format.raw
   Category: metadata_error | Severity: warning
   Error: failed to read exif data
   ðŸ’¡ Suggestion: File will be copied to noexif folder - metadata could not be extracted

Suggested next steps:
  â€¢ Run disk health check (SMART diagnostics)
  â€¢ Verify source files are not corrupted
  â€¢ Check session manifest for detailed error log

Error: import completed with 3 errors (97.0% success rate)
```

## Manifest.jsonl Example (with error details)

```jsonl
{"event":"session_start","ts":"2025-12-15T11:04:00Z","user":"john","input_dir":"/sd","total_files":100}
{"event":"copied","ts":"2025-12-15T11:04:01Z","src":"/sd/IMG_001.jpg","hash":"abc123...","dest":"john/2024/01/01/IMG_001.jpg","browse":"IMG_001.jpg","size":1024000}
{"event":"error","ts":"2025-12-15T11:04:05Z","src":"/sd/corrupted.jpg","error":"hash verification failed after copy","error_category":"hash_mismatch","error_severity":"error","error_suggestion":"File may be corrupted - verify source file integrity or try re-importing"}
{"event":"session_end","ts":"2025-12-15T11:04:07Z","total_scanned":100,"copied":95,"skipped_duplicate":0,"copied_timestamped":2,"errors":3}
```
